data.title: West Ham premium tickets
data.meta_description: Premier League progress and European qualification is the Hammers target this season. West Ham premium tickets are on sale to see the action!
data.text:
‚öΩÔ∏è The bubbles will be blowing this evening at Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park as West Ham take on reigning Premier League champions Manchester City.

West Ham premium tickets are available for the match and all Premier League fixtures at London Stadium this season!

INTERESTED? Complete the short form here (also below ) OR call +44 (0)7931 169180. Simply confirm the game you‚Äôre interested in for prices and how to book.

West Ham enjoyed a memorable 2022/2023 campaign beating Fiorentina 2-1 in the European Conference League final to lift their first major silverware since 1980. The 2023/2024 Premier League did not reach the same heights, but after David Moyes‚Äô departure a new era awaits under manager Julen Lopetegui. Fancy watching the Hammers at London Stadium? West Ham premium tickets are a great option with a range of packages on sale to suit different budgets.

üëÄ READ ON for how to buy West Ham premium tickets, the season so far, London Stadium fixture news and travel tips.

West Ham premium tickets are located in the exclusive Club London area of the stadium. Including access to either the Academy Bar, Great Briton Lounge or Royal East Lounge pre and post-match, padded seats (Great Briton seat view below) on the halfway line together with a complimentary matchday programme and half-time drinks. All-inclusive food and drink packages can be added.

Complete the short form below OR üìû call +44 (0)7931 169180. Confirm the game you‚Äôre interested in for *package/price information and how to book. Premium tickets are on sale for all home matches this season (upcoming games below).

General admission tickets are also available (**non-UK residents only).

* Official packages only. SportonSpec works only with clubs and/or their authorised resellers.

** If you live in the UK general admission tickets must be purchased from West Ham United FC directly.

SEASON SO FAR

West Ham finished 9th last season as David Moyes reign in E20 came to an end. Julen Lopetegui is the new man in charge and the next chapter in West Ham‚Äôs famous footballing history is about to be written.

Up next, it‚Äôs one of the biggest games of the season at London Stadium as West Ham host Premier League champions Manchester City on Saturday 31 August. The Hammers players will be looking to impress their new boss, not to mention their passionate fans. Let the battle commence!

ONES TO WATCH

Electric winger and fan favourite Jarrod Bowen will look to star once again this season after his return from England duty at EURO 2024. Tricky forward Mohammed Kudus adds incredible talent to the side and Brazilian star Lucas Paquet√° can ooze flair in West Ham‚Äôs ranks.

üóìÔ∏è MATCHES COMING UP at London Stadium ‚Äì 2024/2025 season

PL = Premier League, Eur L = Europa League, FC = FA Cup, LC =Carabao Cup

*‚öΩÔ∏è West Ham v Bournemouth on Tuesday 27 August. Kick-off 7.45pm tbc (LC).

‚öΩÔ∏è West Ham v Man City on Saturday 31 August. Kick-off 3pm (PL).

‚öΩÔ∏è West Ham v Chelsea on Saturday 21 Sepember. Kick-off 12.30pm (PL).

‚öΩÔ∏è West Ham v Ipswich on Saturday 5 October. Kick-off 3pm (PL).

‚öΩÔ∏è West Ham v Man Utd on Sunday 27 October. Kick-off 2pm (PL).

*‚öΩÔ∏è West Ham v Everton on Saturday 9 November. Kick-off 3pm (PL).

*‚öΩÔ∏è West Ham v Arsenal on Saturday 30 November. Kick-off 3pm (PL).

*‚öΩÔ∏è West Ham v Wolves on Saturday 7 December. Kick-off 3pm (PL).

*‚öΩÔ∏è West Ham v Brighton on Saturday 21 December. Kick-off 3pm (PL).

*‚öΩÔ∏è West Ham v Liverpool on Saturday 29 December. Kick-off 3pm (PL).

* Date/time subject to change when the TV schedules are confirmed

üöäüöó TRAVEL TIPS

Two stations ‚Äì Stratford and Stratford International ‚Äì within a 10/15-minute walk of London Stadium. Stratford is on the Central & Jubilee lines, Docklands Light Railway (DLR) and London Overground. Also National Rail services operated by Greater Anglia and C2C. Stratford International station is accessible via Docklands Light Railway and Southeastern High Speed 1 services. Hackney Wick station, on the London Overground, is approximately a 15-minute walk. By bus the 388, 339 and D9 services stop close to the stadium.

No spectator parking is available at the venue. Stratford International Station and Westfield Shopping Centre Stratford both have car parks. See this London Stadium ‚ÄòGetting Here‚Äô guide for more info.

MAKE A BOOKING ENQUIRY
